snippet: Friends said Robert De Carlo’s life seemed to spiral down about four years ago when he was hit by a car and then became addicted to prescription painkillers.
abstract: Emerging portrait of Robert De Carlo, drug addict charged with crashing a stolen vehicle into a family in Brooklyn, is that of an increasingly troubled man with a history of breaking the law; De Carlo, arrested in May for robbery, was out of jail pending his next court date when he stole the car, slamming into the family and killing 12-year-old Joie Sellers.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Friends said Robert De Carlo’s life seemed to spiral down about four years ago when he was hit by a car and then became addicted to prescription painkillers.

headline.main: Man Accused in Brooklyn Hit-and-Run Had Trouble With Drugs
headline.print_headline: Man Charged In Fatal Crash Faced Trouble Over Drugs
